definitions.definition: causing or likely to cause death

examples.text: He was charged with possession of a deadly weapon.
The cobra is one of the world's deadliest snakes.
The terrorists have chosen to play a deadly game with the civilian population.
The loss of skills training was deadly for the economy.
They are **deadly enemies** *(= are full of hatred for each other)*.
The missile found its target with deadly accuracy.

definitions.definition: extremely effective, so that no defence is possible

examples.text: His aim is deadly *(= so accurate that he can kill easily)*.
It was the deadly striker's 11th goal of the season.
The man possessed an absolutely deadly charm.

definitions.definition: like a dead person; suggesting death

wordOrigin: Old English dēadlīc ‘mortal, in danger of death’ (see dead, -ly).
